text: Takana, also Takānah-ye Bālā, is a subdistrict and village of Jalrez District, Maidan Wardak Province, Afghanistan. It lies along the Kabul-Behsud Highway, to the west of the town of Jalrez. ==History== The Taliban invaded Takana and Jalrez on July 20, 1997. Wahdat forces, consisting of mainly Hazaras, retreated into the valley and reportedly took out 70 Taliban in a counterattack, setting them on fire. ==Demographics== Though mainly ethnic Hazaras, a population of Tajiks live in the village. ==References== Category:Populated places in Maidan Wardak Province Category:Jalrez District Category:Subdistricts of Maidan Wardak Province Category:July 1997 events in Asia Category:1997 in Afghanistan
title: Takana, Afghanistan
